condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Syria's conflict-affected population have their critical WASH needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP

description.narrative:
From January to December 2019, over 1,750,000 people, including 740,000 children, in NW Syria benefitted from WASH services and supplies,including access to improved water supply, sanitation facilities, non-food items, WASH in institutions i.e. child friendly spaces, schools, and health care facilities and hygiene behavioral promotion.
Emphasis was given to strengthen cluster coordination and rapid response mechanism. Most importantly, over 35 of 82 active member-organizations benefited through technical trainings. In addition, an effective monitoring by cluster field monitors helped early detection of problems and quality management of response. Cluster mechanism also helped advocating and addressing cross cutting issues and risk management. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/04/2020
